clinical_study.brief_title: Qualitative Analysis of Hospital Executives, Physician Administrators, and Hospital Legal Counsels' Perceptions of End-of-Life Care
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Hospital Executives, Physician Administrators, and Hospital Legal Counselsï¿½ Perceptions of End-of-Life Care

brief_summary.textblock: Interviewing hospital executives, physician administrators and hospital legal counsel who work in a hospital setting (academic, governmental, private or community hospital) about their perceptions concerning current and future end-of-life care provided in their facilities

primary_outcome.measure: Perceptions of hospital executive, physician administrator or hospital legal counsel in a hospital setting (academic, governmental, private or community hospital)

arm_group.description: Hospital executives, physician administrators and hospital legal counsel

study_pop.textblock: hospital executive, physician administrator or hospital legal counsel in a hospital setting (academic, governmental, private or community hospital)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Informant is a hospital executive, physician administrator or hospital legal counsel in a hospital setting (academic, governmental, private or community hospital) and is able to communicate perceptions verbally through use of English language. All participants will likely be nonveterans
